intro: Parosela divaricata, commonly known as the variable parosela, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are often fragrant. The fruit is a small capsule that contains several seeds, typical of the Rubiaceae family.
